Reviews.Title: Ok, for the Price
Reviews.Author: Charles W. Jefferson
Reviews.Content: Pro's - Great Display, Visually appealing. Sound Quality is good. Desktop response is good and fluid, comes with Two Batteries and Two Back Covers, one with a Flap Front Cover Attachment. Really nice. The device looks great in Hand. Looks like the Galaxy Note II(Knockoff) But Very Nicely Done. Great response from the Soft Keys next to the Physical Home Button on the Device. Camera Front/Back Take Nice Pics however not high quality. But pics would hold up as nice or decent.Con's - My Biggest issue was the Device l noted this in the description "3G/4G - 850/2100 bands. Fully compatible with at&t;, straight Talk & Net10 at 2G/3G/4G. Compatible with T-Mobile & Simple Mobile at 2G. For Straight Talk, Trac fone, Simple Mobile or Net 10 will requires a manual APN setup."However its not 4G Compatible on TMobile Network, took a few days to configure as the Software kept crashing and stating the option was not available try again later. Took an additional Day to configure Texting to Send. You have to lock the screen if you are making a call and holding the phone to your head as the touch screen interferes with the functionality of the call, often dropping the speaker so you can't hear. The Battery Takes a considerable amount of time to charge, and of course drains moderately fast with normal daily use.I also found the Home/Menu Button is non responsive at times. Having to receive more then a few pushes. The Cameras need Ample Light to be used. Does not work well at all in Low Light even with a light shining directly on you. The light has to be Ambient or Room Lit, So no Web Chatting in Bed.Phone Cover gets in the way of Car Phone Holder, I just leave it open so I can see the screen.All in All. A very good device for the money spent. I will do some research on the 4.1.1 software issues and Rooting as the device is not rooted. Hopefully that will correct some of the quirkiness.

Reviews.Title: Not as advertised, but a good product for the buck. Doesn't work on the 3G Straight talk network, let alone on the 4G.
Reviews.Author: Victor H. Martinez "VHM Digital"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone in the hopes of getting 3G service from Straight Talk AT&T; network. The problem is that AT&T; 3G is on the 850- 1900 MHZ frequencies, while this phone only picks up the 850, 2100 MHZ. I have a Straight Talk AT&T; compatible sim card and it only works on the 2G network (EDGE) with this phone. Also tried the T-Mobile sim card and same thing, since the 3G frequencies on this network are 1700, 2100. You get the 2G (EDGE) as well. If you want the 4G, don't even think about it; it doesn't work at all. I tried so many things trying to make it work with no luck and as a confirmed customer I advise you to look else where if you are looking for 3G or 4G here, in the US. If you are just looking for a nice, cheap and fast phone this one is a great one. This phone is fast and very responsive, awesome looking and great memory. Too bad about the frequencies it handles. Get it if you only want good quality calls, texting and 2G speeds here, in the US. It may work on 3G and 4G other countries. Again, remember: IT DOES NOT WORK ON THE 3G NOR ON THE 4G HERE, IN THE US.

Reviews.Title: Nice and responsive... Wins "Initial Quality" award, but that's all.
Reviews.Author: J Ponder
Reviews.Content: This phone turned out to be a very nice and responsive phone.  It has a beautiful display.  I actually like this phone, but it will not meet my needs.  I purchased mainly to use mobile web on Straight Talk byob with AT&T; network.  Unfortunately, I can only get around 114-145 Kbps over mobile data.  Further troubleshooting showed that the phone is only 3G capable on CDMA technology band, not the GSM band...  Well that's just crappy since most networks that allow sim card swapping operate on GSM...Update 3/25/2013:It's been not quite a week and I feel I need to update some info.  The phone operates on GSM and WCDMA (previously stated CDMA) bands.  Upon further discussion, research, and troubleshooting, it appears that the phone may have the ability to reach 3G/4G speeds.  I do show a "H" above the signal bar most of the time.  Occasionally I see an "E" and I think I saw a "G" just briefly, once.  Seemingly, the "H" represents the HSPA/HSPA+ bands.  Even with the "H" I was still only reaching 110-500Kbps down when in or near my home.  However, the up was 300-700 Kbps.  Really strange that the upstream has been consistantly higher than the downstream.I decided to venture away from my neighborhood and test the speeds further.  About 8 miles away, at my church, I was able to reach between 700Kbps and 1.2 Mbps downstream, and 600-980 Kbps upstream.  Even driving around I can get up to 1.2 Mbps.  I'll try a few more areas of the city.  I hope to start seeing downstreams at 2.5Mbps or better.  At this time, I can't say whether the speed issue is with the phone or the AT&T; network in my area.UPDATED 3/26/2013:Because my download speed was typically around 120-240 Kbps with occasional spikes up to about 800Kbps, I decided to try another test.  I did see speeds peak at 1.2 Mbps at one point, but the average for the test would still end up around 400 Kbps.  I actually only saw that type of peak on that one night around 10:30PM EDT.  My upload speeds are 3-4 times higher than my downstream speeds.  Since this was using ATT network via StraightTalk, I decided I would try the phone actually on ATT network with ATT sim card.1.  Contacted ATT and asked them to simply add the 4G data plan to my account that I was only using for calls.  They asked for the IMEI number to determine what plan the phone could handle.  Once I provided this, they could only add the 3G data plan as the IMEI was not recognized as 4G.  We tried both IMEI numbers.  Once this was in place, I began testing again using the APN that was defaulted from the sim.  I was still only getting downstreams of approx 125Kbps.2.  I decided to get ATT support on the line.  Because the phone could not qualify for the 4G plan, the gentlemen I was working with used a dummy IMEI for a Samsumg Note 2.  Once he did this, he was able to add the 4G data plan.  Still, the downloads were approx 125-240 Kbps.  He then walked me through add APNs that were specific to 3G and 4G services.  We used three different APN settings that ATT typically use.  At no point could I get over 240 Kbps on avg downstream.  However, I saw huge increases in upstream data to the range of 700 Kbps- 1.1 Mbps between the different APNs.  Finally, the guy said he could not help me any further.  He also mentioned that seeing the "H" next to the signal bars only represented 3G service.  He says 4G would show "4" or "4G" next to the bars.  I have never seen either of those show up for 4G.After fighting with this phone and settings, I finally got just over 5 Mbps just as I was ready to give up.  I tested while at my son's doctor office.  I drove around testing and began getting 2.5-5.5 Mbps.  This was using the ATT sim.  I did not have the Straight talk sim with me.  Upon nearing my home, the signal disappeared and I began getting the slow speeds again.  Looks like the network in areas I frequent aren't very good.  I will test the ST sim in other areas again.  I guess I came away knowing the phone has the ability to reach speeds of 4-5 Mbps.  With that said, this phone is a winner for me.Updated 3/28/2013:Drove to the areas where I was getting really good speeds with the AT&T; sim and tested the straight talk sim.  Still getting decent speeds, but the Straight Talk speed are less than those with AT&T.;  In some cases nearly 2.5 Mbps less.  It appears that the speeds are throttled from the typical AT&T; service speeds.  Still not bad speeds for the price.  I was reaching 1.5-3.5 with the Straight Talk sim.  I think it is still worth it for $45 monthly.Updated 7/29/2013:So after about 4 months, this phone has been retired.  Although the initial quality seemed very nice, in the not-so-long run, it's now known that all the phone offered was initial quality.  The screen started getting it's first dead pixels (or dark spots) about 2 -3 weeks in.  I ignored the first, but then several others followed after about 4-6 weeks.  Call quality got really bad.  The signal would go in and out all the time and conversations got very choppy.  The screen would not remain off when holding the phone to ear.  So quite often I would dial numbers and place the calls on hold with my ear.  When using the speaker, often the phone would revert back to the ear piece in the mist of conversation.  This would happen frequently while the phone sat on my desk during conference calls.  So there was no accidental pressing of the screen.  Plus the screen would be off during the change.As an Android device used for emails, web surfing, and other non-phone related items, it is okay.  It met my needs, except for the pixel loss.  As for a phone, I often found myself pulling the sim and placing it in a standard, old school, flip phone when needing to just make calls.  Now the sim has found a, permanent, new home.  I've never retired a phone so quickly.I always see the automobile commercials on televisions stating how certain vehicles received the JD Powers award for "Initial Quality" and wondered how they fared after a couple years when the 'initial' new feel wore off...  Well, if they are anything like this phone, we should all stay away from those cars too...  lol

Reviews.Title: Horrible Phone
Reviews.Author: Rachael S.
Reviews.Content: I recieved this phone after about 2 weeks I bought an T-Mobile sim card that works on straight talk, I called Straight talk to activate it and they would not activate it for me becuase I needed an at@t Sim card that works on Straight talk, so i did that and called back they once again told me they could not activate it for me. This phone is horrible! The camera works upside down on some of the apps, It is a knock of off the note. I would suggest not buying this phone.

Reviews.Title: False Advertisement
Reviews.Author: James Saintilien
Reviews.Content: Phone is no where near 4G, Not even 2G.Reception is poor.Memory is lowBluetooth does not workSeems to switch back to some Chinese mode and forces Phone to reset.

Reviews.Title: Ummm i'll pass
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: The phone is actually okay for the price, that is if it actually would work past 1 month.  3 weeks in to geting the phone it started haveing some software issues and then wouldnt even turn on.  BeforE that he had to replace a phone because it shut off 12 hrs into having it..So now im stuck with a hunk of junk an out of 180 dollars because its over 30 days, An it cant be fixed cause the dont make parts for them?  wow thanks.  I wouldnt waste you money on these cheep phones.  Just get a older model name brand an save your self the hassle..TRUST ME!ohh an seller wouldnt refund my money would just send out same model phone..not good cause i saw the phoes were cheaply made..Good luck an i wouldnt buy again

Reviews.Title: Affordable phone
Reviews.Author: Susan Perna
Reviews.Content: I loved this phone but had to return it because we didnt need a cell phone anymore. I highly recommend this phone to others as its a GREAT phone! and it's affordable

Reviews.Title: Dont Get
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: THIS PHONE IS A HORRIBLE. I RECEIVED THIS PHONE TODAY AFTER WAITING A MONTH. AN IT DOES NOT WORK AT ALL. I CANT EVEN GET IT TO CHARGE TO TURN IT ON. IM VERY DISAPPOINTED!

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Chad
Reviews.Content: Love this phone. Love the large screen. Wish the volume would go higher. But overall this is a great phone. Very happy

Reviews.Title: Sucked Get a Name brand phone
Reviews.Author: Daniel N.
Reviews.Content: ok, this is my 2nd review of this phone. i got the phone and it was decent.... then after 4 hrs of use that is when s*** messed up. the phone would become un responsive but it would only last for like 3 min then work for like a day and do it again, aside that i noticed when you would charge it via wall charger the phone would press the screen for me, not in a good way either it was like 50 fingers on my screen all at once messing stuff up. but that was when it was charging so no problem right? wrong the battery only last about 3hrs of screen time and i used this phone in collage so that sucked.. after 2months of this annoyance the phone started to work perfectly and about 1 week later the screen just died.. like the touch for it stopped working..... Long story short just get a BRAND NAMED phone where the company will help you and fix it or play russian roulette on getting a halfway decent one... i have a nexus 4 now on straight talk and it works flawlessly dont get a cheeply made phone and plan on it working for a while (note casses nor any other will work on this phone and they never got back to me about a new case )

Reviews.Title: BAD BAD BAD
Reviews.Author: steven
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box, BAD batteries. Maybe a fluke. Take a look at the PEA8800. I bought that one and i love it.

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: Todd Moore
Reviews.Content: this phone worked very well. i compared it toward other expensive smartphones and mines did just as wellpeople couldnt believe it was a clone phone from China. its a great phone.

Reviews.Title: Not great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It was great at first and then the speakers started with a scratching noise.  The phone will shut off during a phone call or go into airplane mode at will.

Reviews.Title: the phone
Reviews.Author: Derrick Gibson
Reviews.Content: nice camera nice size features don't work to optimal potential blue tooth range very very short!!! phone could have been a lot better.

Reviews.Title: I was a little nervous but ...
Reviews.Author: Bill Adams
Reviews.Content: I got to say that this little beauty did everything it promised and more ! .. I kept waiting for something to 'not work' .. but it is fantastic .. and for this price .. it's a no brainer !!I wrote that on the 7th ... I liked it so much I just ordered another one !! on the 15th .. (she talked me out of mine !)So nice .. I did it twice !!Hey .. when I have a complaint I don't hesitate to make it known ...But when somebody treats you right and sells a damn good product for the price you pay I say jump on it !

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: jasunwirt
Reviews.Content: Wow...this phone is amazing.great display sturdy...fast ..2 batteries a jelly case an extra face cover extra back cover....it scored a 6735 on antutu....even my grandma likes it for the large font size.

Reviews.Title: This Phone
Reviews.Author: Alli
Reviews.Content: I got this phone yesterday. I do agree that it is a pretty nice phone, kinda big too, but none the less I have come to realize that the front camera is pretty whack and the back one isn't all that. The two batteries I have received with this phone .... useless .. the first one I tried only gave me an hour and about 20 mins of power time and the second one gave me about 5 mins even thought it was fully charged. I do believe that these batteries are either used or not good at all, I only installed 4 apps and I doubt they are using up that much percentage of the batteries.My chip works fine in the phone. T-Mobile to be exact, I just find it awkward that not everyone I text receives my messages, but I can get theirs. As of the internet speed ... umm kinda slow too maybe its because of the location that I'm at I have yet to try it on the road. My biggest concerns are just the Cameras and both Batteries.

Reviews.Title: WORSE PURCHASE I EVER MADE!!!!!
Reviews.Author: carol evans
Reviews.Content: Not realizing what I was doing. didn't know that it was a bootleg phone. I guess you all saw me coming and got me. As a matter of fact it doesn't even deserve the 1 star, but that was the only way that I could say what I needed to say. "RIP OFF"

Reviews.Title: Very nice phone
Reviews.Author: Adi
Reviews.Content: I use net 10 I get hot spot for free...phone is same as samsung note 2. I love it. Phone is great

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: bambam
Reviews.Content: This phone is awesome. It comes with all the accessories for the same price. You got about yourself to day

Reviews.Title: Satisfied so far
Reviews.Author: Don "Don"
Reviews.Content: Ordered and received this phone in a very timely manner from Electronics Mart. Was able to set up the WLAN quickly and so far it is very fast. I'm using it with the ATT Net10 plan and the SIM card installed flawlessly with the instructions provided by the vendor. One Walmart I called said they wanted $67.00 for the 3 sim card pack. I bought the same pack on sale at Radio Shack for $10. Phone vendor corresponded promptly regarding a couple of questions. Evidently APNs change occasionally because those given by the vendor and older ones on the internet were not helpful.  I found the correct APN settings on the Net10 site and the data kicked in almost immediately. I turn off the data connection whenever I'm in range of wireless. App has a setting that gives a warning and then the shut-off for data. You can adjust those to whatever levels you want. Net10s data is not unlimited, but I think it will be enough based on past analysis of my former Verizon account. At this point I haven't had need for a second SIM, but wanted the flexibility of using that. Good screen, comes with all the advertised items including an extra battery and screen protector is already installed. The camera isn't great, but I don't think most phone cameras are even if they are high pixel count. As a DSLR user I don't depend on it except in unexpected situations. The biggest benefit is a good phone going from my $85 monthly Verizon plan to a $45 Net10 plan ($50 initially and $45 thereafter with on-line registration and auto re-fills). I like the larger screen size but didn't want to go all the way to 5". The google browser has quite a few Chinese(?) characters, but I downloaded the Firefox for Android browser and it works fine. I'm not a super-techie but I was able to work my way through this phones setup.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: OBH
Reviews.Content: First I had my doubts; you know Chinese products are sometimes known for low quality. But WOW, this product really amazed me. Everything I have tried and installed from Google play is working with no problems at all. The two SIMs can work simultaneously. I tried it in Mexico too and both Movistar and Telcel work well with this cell. Battery life is good and it easily last for more than a day with an average use. The only problem is that is not the exact same size as the original Samsun Note 2 so it will be hard to find accessories for it such as skin case covers. Other than that I’ll definitely recommend this product.I’ll update my review if I find something after using it for a longer time.

Reviews.Title: for android knock off from china of Note 2 4.1 jelly bean
Reviews.Author: jen
Reviews.Content: it sucks I had the phone for less than 3 months, dropped it once and it now doesn't work. it is slow and I spent 233.00 on it. the apps didn't work right and I had a hard time even putting Netflix on it, and then when I finally got it, it didn't work at all. you cannot video chat it cuts out and the people cannot hear you and they are jumbled looking. I hate this phone wish I could get my money back. it is so slow. just cause it has 4.1 Jelly bean and a big screen doesn't mean it will work well. it's a knock off. hope people in china are just as pissed as i am. and on top of it I tried to contact the seller and they NEVER contacted me back to answer all my questions. I am furious if you cannot tell. Please don't get this phone. it may work for some people that can put up with it, but you are putting up with a lot. I had to give it one star or I wouldn't have given it any. I really want my money back. I asked all the questions I wanted to know and didn't get them answered it shows the seller doesn't care they just want their money.

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL!!!
Reviews.Content: Best phone I've ever had, I have plenty of apps downloaded and still have plenty of memory!! It's very fast with downloading, Internet is also fast!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE this phone!! Took a day or two to get used to the size since I've had all small phones, but I can say I don't regret buying this phone!! Would recommend this phone to all my friends!! I've gotten so many compliments on this phone, and everyone is amazed by the price I paid on it!! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: first smart phone experience
Reviews.Author: George D.
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for my 88yr old father ,his first touch smart phone works pretty good for him all though the screen went black on him and he kinda freaked out he took the battery out and it finally came back on also the phone was suppose to be new and it came with someone's contacts and some website bookmarks

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Jermaine Dupree Ducksworth
Reviews.Content: I received this item about 3 weeks after ordering it, which is not bad. The set up with Net10 was rather easy. I'm enjoying my new phone with no problems to report!"

Reviews.Title: bad service
Reviews.Author: jasmine
Reviews.Content: I just purchase phone not even a month and I just received it and the speaker stop working already wish I would have read comments before I purchased I would have saved my money I was hype for nothing highly pissed

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY IS TERRIBLE
Reviews.Author: DANIEL BUENO-JOSEPHSON
Reviews.Content: SAVE YOUR MONEY IS A VERY BAD CELL PHONE, GOT ONE I COULDNT USE IT, IT JAM,  YOU SHOULD NOT DSLE THIS CELLDBUENO1051

Reviews.Title: Where? Can I find a replacement screen
Reviews.Author: Frank R. Canzaniello
Reviews.Content: The product itself is well worth the money but there is no where to get a replacement screen. After getting the product for a client she had it in her back pocket and sat down and cracked the screen. The screen is a 5.3 inch screen so this can happen because of its size. There is no replacement screens for this phone as far as I can see. If anyone out there knows where to buy a replacement screen please e-mail me ASAP.Frankcanzaniello@yahoo.com thank you!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Nothing good to hope for
Reviews.Author: Yugesh
Reviews.Content: Trust me when I say it. Spent my money Wont try it next time. This is complete waste of money. The customer service is bad. The only reason I gave a two star was good shipping. else 0

Reviews.Title: Better than I imagined, great phone!
Reviews.Author: alan
Reviews.Content: The phone is great. Super fast, and better than I expected. Battery life is good. The phone has a lot of bells and whistles I wasn't expecting, I am really loving it. It works with the Google Play Android Market. The seller answered all my questions, and gave me good advice. I highly recommend both this phone, and the seller. You can order with confidence!

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Fredric Sellers
Reviews.Content: This is a well rounded phone you can use many different apps and formats on it.The phone has a large nice screen and responds nice and is bright.There are different storage options built in and to connect it to your pc the app is already set up in the phone and operates nicely.The back cover is a little thin and you have to be careful removing it but,you should not have any problems just handle with care.Overall this is well worth the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Just got it!
Reviews.Author: ERIC ALTON PIERCE
Reviews.Content: 10 days ahead of schedule and its nice! It's response time is great. Haven't set up my SIM cards yet so will report later on quality of phone features.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: Big Blue
Reviews.Content: Just activated my phone with consumer cellular without a problem. I am still trying to figure out how to reach 3g and how to remove the chinese apps.  The phone is fast however and beautiful as well. It paired quickly with my auto and the sound is good, although volume could be a little louder. The radio works great also. I gave this phone 4 stars only because I cannot get 3g. However for my purposes , it is a great phone.

Reviews.Title: about my android phone.
Reviews.Author: ayaz m bhuiyan
Reviews.Content: Little slow and camera is not so good. But in this price its OK. Processor should be more fast. And ram should be more powerful.

Reviews.Title: Propaganda enganoisa
Reviews.Author: Alexandre Guildo Guimaraes Fernandes
Reviews.Content: I thought the product with good quality, but not like the propoganda that is offering a product with characteristics different from what was sent to me and unfortunately I can not return because I live in Brazil and I had to stay with him anyway. That and purpose of my note is zero. Without further. Alexandre.

ProductInfo.Features:
Unlocked world GSM phone. 3G/4G - 850/2100, 2G -850/900/1800/1900. Compatible with at&t;, T-Mobile, Straight Talk, Simple Mobile and other GSM networks. Please make sure your SIM card is not locked with PUK code.
3G/4G - 850/2100 bands. Fully compatible with at&t;, stright Talk & Net10 at 2G/3G/4G. compatilble with T-Mobile & Simple Mobile at 2G. For Straight Talk, Trac fone, Simple Mobile or Net 10 will requires a manual APN setup.
MTK6577 CPU - Dual Core 1.2GHz. Newest Android 4.1.1 Jelly Bean.
Large 5.3 inch 5 Point Capacitive Multi-Touch Screen.
Free Tether - Use your 3G/4G data service as a WiFi hot spot and connect your notebook, ipad or other device for free. No need to pay monthly tether fee.
ProductInfo.Name: PAE7100 Unlocked Android Phone 4.1.1 Jelly Bean 5.3 Inch Screen MTK6577 1GHz Dual SIM 3G/4G Free Tether WiFi AT&T Straight Talk T-Mobile - Shipping from California
